title: After 30 years the Virgin and BA rivalry flies to new heights
text:
In many ways Willie Walsh is everything Sir Richard Branson is not. Forthright and yet somehow understated, the Dublin-born boss of British Airways owner IAG has the knack of flying under the radar.

Take a recent trip to the CN Tower in Toronto. Descending in the vertigo-inducing glass-bottomed lift, one American declared that, despite appearances, it was safer than flying in a Boeing 737 Max. “And I should know – I’m in the airline business,” he loudly proclaimed.

In the corner, quietly minding his own business stood the 57-year-old Walsh, unnoticed by the the outspoken airlines aficionado. It’s hard to think Branson’s presence would have gone unnoticed in a similar situation.

Mr Walsh has little...
description: In many ways Willie Walsh is everything Sir Richard Branson is not.
